The install is running on the latest build Aperi-incubation-R04-071018-160553.zip

Hi Todd,  the button issue may have something to do with X terminal, once I switched to VNC, the install was working fine but I had problem to start the aperi.sh script  -  I received :bad interpreter: no such file or directory when I ran ./aperi.sh 

Can you take a look?   Thanks

Hi Todd,  thanks for the help, the changing of lookAndFeel options didn't cure the problem.

I checked the log again,  it seems ant install did start UI screens but the button for NEXT screen is not working.

I am using cygwin to ssh into Linux box and you can use vnc to log into tivoli19 - vnc server = 9.52.172.162:1 pw=dqh2pass

The latest install image is under /aperi  

Hans H. Lin,  Tivoli SAN Software Development

10/21/2007 09:39 PM	
	To
	Hans Lin/San Jose/IBM@IBMUS
	cc
	
	Subject
	Fw: [Bug 206968] Can not correctly set Look And Feel:javax.swing.plaf.metal. MetalLookAndFeel.setAntiAliased(boolean) running Aperi GUI install on Linux platform
	
	
	
	

I need some help (for future reference) gaining full access to the remote linux box in such a way that the display shows up on my screen.  Do you use the DISPLAY:0 command?  

In the meanwhile, can you try the following as a potential resolution to the problem?  

In the file antinstall-config.xml, there is a setting that looks like:

<installer
        ui="swing,text"
        verbose="true"
        debug="true"
        lookAndFeel="native"

REPLACE "native" with "null" and retry.  If this works, I may just change this setting for both platforms - fixing the defect.  

Other options if "null" fails include "greymetal" and "jgoodies".  Thanks Hans!

Todd Singleton
Software Engineer, Tivoli, IBM
Menlo Park, CA
email: toddsing@us.ibm.com
